title: @Riot We need more Sightstones.
body:
What about have a cheaper Standard sightstone and that same can build into 3 different Sighstone?

Standard Sightstone. http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png

> {{item:1006}} + {{item:1004}} + 340g (total cost 700g)
> 
> Stats:
>	+50% Health Regeneration.
>                 +50% Mana Regeneration.

Why Mana and Health Regeneration? Because are stats that work's well in lane phase, specially in the early game, also are most "general" stats, and everybody build the sighstone like first or second item when play as support. 

_Soraka for example have a negative impact when she builds the actual Sightstone because her W cost 15 hp more and don't grant anything in exchange._

Others like Braum or Taric benefits a lot when builds the sighstone.

_Braum gains extra 4 of damage by evey Q._

_Taric gains extra health on his Q: 8 hp in his allies and 11 hp himself._

So we need a sighstone more cheaper and with more "useful" stats.

The Standard Sighstone http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png can build into 3 differents "Sightstone":

* Ruby Sightstone {{item:2045}} 

*  Sapphire Sightstone {{item:2049}} 

* Citrine Sightstone http://i.imgur.com/wVPEE8K.png .



Ruby Sightstone {{item:2045}}

> Standard Sighstone http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png + {{item:1028}} + 500g

> Stats:
>	+75% Health Regeneration.
>                 +75% Mana Regeneration.
>             +350 HP.

Sapphire Sightstone {{item:2049}} 

> Standard Sighstone http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png + {{item:1027}} + 500g

> Stats:
>	+100% Health Regeneration.
>                 +100% Mana Regeneration.
>             +350 Mana.


Citrine Sightstone http://i.imgur.com/wVPEE8K.png .

> Standard Sighstone http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png + {{item:1052}}  + 500g

> Stats:
>	+50% Health Regeneration.
>                 +50% Mana Regeneration.
>             +50 AP .

Obviusly all the 3 have the same passive and active.

> Passive	Unique: Ward Refresh - Holds 5 charges and refills upon visiting the shop.
> 
> Active	Unique: Ghost Ward - Consumes a charge to place a Stealth Ward that reveals the surrounding area for 3 minutes. A player may only have 3 Stealth Wards on the map at one time.

I know that items like {{item:3801}} {{item:1026}}  or {{item:3114}} can fit better, but the idea is the each gem, crystal or book give the new color and stats to the Standard Sighstone http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png .

So what are your thoughts? Can this create more diversity on the Sightstone?

replies.body: Props for your effort. Lets get the conversation started.
So what are your thoughts?

I like the idea of sight stone being placed within finished support items that are like the support gold items. So you could have frost queen and what ever. I just think the percents are off. But Riot would balance that themselves. Probably need one with magic resist and armor more than 50 ap. Or something that did additional magic damage on hit. But its all better than just having one sight stone to build.
So like a "fusion" of sight stone being and finished support items?
It might be tricky if their were two actives on an item. I would say create another group of supp items where sight stone was incorporated.
Start with the conversation, share your thoughs here and now :P
You mean the actual 2Ruby Sighstone" passive?
Well IMO prefer a stat based variations of Sighstone, the passive part can keept like the same.

I think it would be cool to have a regenerating sightstone to generate more wards over time cause some times you stay out on the fields long enough and possibly secure another obj. It would be nice to have a extra ward that generated after placing your first ones and move up the ward line. Another cool one that probably isnt very practical since they put kalista in the game is a ward that scouts, but is not very practical because it would devalue kalistas traveling spook things alot. I like the idea of different sightstones alot but giving them benifits like 40 ap is too good  imo because some junglers already pick up sightstone but sacrifice more tanky stats I think giving that option would just increase the amount of sightstones we see outside of supports making junglers like nidalee not have to sacrifice much as far as damage.
This is why some people are hesitant to buy sight stone in the new order of having trinkets. There has been many times I had to back just for my sight stone. Lame

Thanks by your positive comments. If we have more wards we have more vision and more vision = gg.

Seriously its a very good idea have more diversity, this open more {{item:3341}} in all the Sighstone users, I don't see any problem with this kind of diversity.

I like the idea of having upgrades that do not come with additional health (you guessed it, I'm a {{champion:16}} main), but I do not really think the game needs more sightstone upgrades. They would make support build paths even more standardized than they are now. I wouldn't object if each of the options were about as weak as the Ruby Sightstone, though, so we would not feel compelled to build it if we didn't need to.

I don't agree. If I play Naut, i want health, if I play Nami I want ap. Armor and\or MR are best on Leona and Taric. I don't play Soraka so I don't know. Some even like cool down. You can't have any passive that steps on the toes of trinket power or auras of current items.

Actually With the stats and the cost prices are like 150% more efficient than the actual Ruby sighstone. Maybe are a little overpowered, but if a fair reward if you upgrade your Sighstone.

Can you deep more in this: _They would make support build paths even more standardized than they are now._

I didn't take the time to write particularly intelligently in my first post, so I'll try to clear it up: I would be quite pleased with the introduction of alternative sightstone upgrades if they are kept as weak as the Ruby Sightstone. My concern is that adding sightstone upgrades that are clearly worth buying will cause almost every support build to necessarily include an upgraded sightstone, aggravating the already semi-present problem of supports having largely pre-determined build paths (such as {{item:3069}} {{item:2049}} {{item:1001}} {{item:3222}}). I enjoy the thought process involved in selecting mid-game items based on how the game is going, but adding a semi-mandatory sightstone upgrade would delay the interesting part of my build and generally make the game just a little less interesting. It is basically the reasoning that Riot representatives have used when explaining why {{item:2045}} has been kept so weak.

Well the decision depend one each user, Example: 

I personally using Soraka try some like this: Start with {{item:3301}} and in my first  two backs get http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png , {{item:3096}} and {{item:1001}}. in my next back then complete {{item:3069}} and {{item:3117}}. Next I build a {{item:1027}} and try to rush{{item:3105}} to eventually build into {{item:3060}}.

My build in taht moment is like: {{item:3117}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3060}}  http://i.imgur.com/9AIFmsY.png and {{item:1027}} (Maybe a{{item:2043}} {{item:3341}} too)

So in that point I can decide to build my {{item:1027}} into {{item:3024}} or {{item:2049}} (the mana enhanced) That depends of the "events" of the game, but this is the point, with more variety we hace more acces to different build paths. a simple {{item:1027}} can turn in more armor or in a more utility. If they have a HARD AD team comp I rush the {{item:3110}}. if not can go {{item:2049}} . At this point I maybe win or lose the game, but I have a chance I end with {{item:3285}} on My Soraka to the extra spd and push more fast ({{item:3023}}  can be other option). but I don't see any problem with the Sighstone diversity.

I like the mega-thread suggestions.
